data.enText: to risk money on a card game, horse race, etc.
to gamble at cards
to gamble on the horses

data.chText: 我把赢了的钱全压在最后一场赛马上了。
data.enText: I gambled all my winnings on the last race.

data.chText: 冒风险；碰运气；以…为赌注
data.enText: to risk losing sth in the hope of being successful

data.chText: 他在以自己的声誉为这笔交易作赌注。
data.enText: He's gambling his reputation on this deal.

data.chText: 拿孩子们的未来冒险是错误的。
data.enText: It was wrong to gamble with our children's future.
He was a compulsive gambler (= found it difficult to stop) .
gamble sth↔away
to lose sth such as money, possessions, etc. by gambling
gamble on sth/on doing sth
to take a risk with sth, hoping that you will be successful

data.chText: 他碰运气看能否在最后时刻买到票。
data.enText: He gambled on being able to buy a ticket at the last minute.
an action that you take when you know there is a risk but when you hope that the result will be a success

data.chText: 她知道是在冒险，但她认为冒这个险值得。
data.enText: She knew she was taking a gamble but decided it was worth it.

data.chText: 他们一开始就把资金投到这家公司，结果这一冒险获得了成功。
data.enText: They invested money in the company right at the start and the gamble paid off (= brought them success) .

ex.chText: 我们在那匹马上下了很大的赌注。
ex.enText: We gambled heavily on that horse.

synonyms.bx: 指为获得钱物而在纸牌、赛马等中投机冒险。

ex.chText: 我同你打赌5美元英国队会赢得世界杯。
ex.enText: I bet you 5 dollars that the British team will win the World Cup.

ex.chText: 他在那匹白马上下了50美元的赌注。
ex.enText: He bet $50 on the white horse.
I bet that he wouldn't come.

synonyms.bx: 多指对比赛等打赌，也指双方对有疑惑、争执之事打赌。

ex.chText: 我将把我的名誉赌在这个结果上。
ex.enText: I will stake my good reputation on the outcome.

ex.chText: 他把所有的钱都押在这桩有风险的生意上。
ex.enText: He staked all his money on the risky business.

synonyms.bx: 指用贵重或重要之物当赌注，如名誉、财产等，通常与介词 on 连用。

data.enText: gamble sth↔away
to lose sth such as money, possessions, etc. by gambling
gamble on sth/on doing sth
to take a risk with sth, hoping that you will be successful

data.chText: 他碰运气看能否在最后时刻买到票。
data.enText: He gambled on being able to buy a ticket at the last minute.

tr: money that is risked for possible monetary gain
take a risk in the hope of a favorable outcome
example: When you buy these stocks you are gambling

value.def: A gamble is a risky action or decision that you take in the hope of gaining money, success, or an advantage over other people.

example.ex: Yesterday, he named his cabinet and took a big gamble in the process.
example.tran: 昨天他冒了很大的风险任命了内阁成员。

example.ex: ...the French president's risky gamble in calling a referendum.
example.tran: 法国总统决定举行全民公决的冒险之举

value.def: If you gamble on something, you take a risky action or decision in the hope of gaining money, success, or an advantage over other people.

example.ex: Few firms will be willing to gamble on new products...
example.tran: 很少有公司愿意冒险开发新产品。

example.ex: They are not prepared to gamble their careers on this matter...
example.tran: 他们不愿意把自己的事业押在这件事上。

example.ex: Who wants to gamble with the life of a friend?
example.tran: 谁会拿朋友的性命作赌注？

gramarinfo.label: Also V, V n, V that

value.def: If you gamble an amount of money, you bet it in a game such as cards or on the result of a race or competition. People who gamble usually do it frequently.

example.ex: Most people visit Las Vegas to gamble their hard-earned money...
example.tran: 大多数人拿着辛苦挣来的钱去拉斯维加斯赌博。

example.ex: John gambled heavily on the horses...
example.tran: 约翰在这几匹马上下了很大的赌注。

example.ex: Britain is the only country in Europe that allows minors to gamble...
example.tran: 英国是欧洲唯一一个允许未成年人赌博的国家。

example.ex: He gambled away his family estate on a single throw of the dice.
example.tran: 他掷了一次骰子便把家产输得精光。
